intro: Staelia paganuccii, commonly known as the Paganucci's staelia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, which helps reduce water loss. Staelia paganuccii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
